comments.author: HerbSammons@comcast.net
comments.creator: HerbSammons@comcast.net
comments.text:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061204 Firefox/2.0.0.1 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061204 Firefox/2.0.0.1 I'm using the following Javascript code to pass data to a asp routine that displays it an Iframe (for later printing), the Iframe as you can see is 50x20 so that I can find it, ultimately it will be 1x1. Since it is still small I tried to use "Show only this frame" and then "Open frame in new window" to display it's content. The problem is that although the new window (re)displays the Iframe content as provided by the source page it doesn't "repost" the original arguments passed to the source page. Consequently if these arguments are used to build the Iframe display content, the new window does not reflect what is actually in the original Iframe. ==================================================================== Iframe setup:
==================================================================== Routine called by form submit: <%@ language = JavaScript%> <% var foo; foo = Request.Form(); %> TEMPORARY Display Request object TEMPORARY................

foo =
<% Response.Write (foo); %>

==================================================================== Results if Iframe is displayed via "Show only this frame" or "Open frame in new window": TEMPORARY................ foo = ==================================================================== Results if "select all" is used to copy Iframe content to notepad: TEMPORARY................ foo = Ticket_ID=12345&Caller=C101 ==================================================================== Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.create an I frame 2.populate the Iframe with dynamic content based on arguments passed to an asp module 3.use "Show only this frame" and then "Open frame in new window" to display it's content. Actual Results: TEMPORARY................ foo = Expected Results: TEMPORARY................ foo = Ticket_ID=12345&Caller=C101
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061204 Firefox/2.0.0.1 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061204 Firefox/2.0.0.1 I'm using the following Javascript code to pass data to a asp routine that displays it an Iframe (for later printing), the Iframe as you can see is 50x20 so that I can find it, ultimately it will be 1x1. Since it is still small I tried to use "Show only this frame" and then "Open frame in new window" to display it's content. The problem is that although the new window (re)displays the Iframe content as provided by the source page it doesn't "repost" the original arguments passed to the source page. Consequently if these arguments are used to build the Iframe display content, the new window does not reflect what is actually in the original Iframe. ==================================================================== Iframe setup:
==================================================================== Routine called by form submit: <%@ language = JavaScript%> <% var foo; foo = Request.Form(); %> TEMPORARY Display Request object TEMPORARY................

foo =
<% Response.Write (foo); %>

==================================================================== Results if Iframe is displayed via "Show only this frame" or "Open frame in new window": TEMPORARY................ foo = ==================================================================== Results if "select all" is used to copy Iframe content to notepad: TEMPORARY................ foo = Ticket_ID=12345&Caller=C101 ==================================================================== Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.create an I frame 2.populate the Iframe with dynamic content based on arguments passed to an asp module 3.use "Show only this frame" and then "Open frame in new window" to display it's content. Actual Results: TEMPORARY................ foo = Expected Results: TEMPORARY................ foo = Ticket_ID=12345&Caller=C101

do you still see this problem when using version 3.5 or 3.6?
If not, please close the bug (resolution WORKSFORME is one possibility).
And if you do see the problem, please provide an update comment.

comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.text: No reply, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.x or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
comments.raw_text: No reply, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.x or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
comments.author: tdowner@mozilla.com
